page.title: 09Waltham Choral Society.
page.content: Waltham Choral Society has existed for twenty-two years.It was originally the Methodist Church Choir until Mrs. Evelyn Harper,the first conductor changed it to Waltham Choral Society. There have been four conductors since. There were twenty members but now there are sixty. They used to meet at the old school room down Mill View. They now meet in the Church Hall, from 7.30 until 9.00 P.M. When the Society perform the men wear a dinner suit and the women wear a white blouse and a black skirt, soloists may wear a different coloured blouse.During the past ten years they have become more ambitious in their choice of music, the last piece being "Judas Maccabaeus" by Handel.They are invited to perform at different places in the county and have been asked to sing at the opening of a new church.
